intro: Humboltia breviflora, commonly known as the short-flowered humboldtia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or white. Its leaves are simple and ovate, often with a hairy texture. Humboltia breviflora is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along stream banks.
